table.title: Cluster EFW Operations
table.description: This list is intended to cover all non-standard operations of EFW, planned or accidental, from 2001-10-01.

operation.desc: The 10Hz filter on probe 3 failed at this time, and has never recovered.

Verify sweep interval settings. Will cause loss of spin fits for 25 minutes. 07:30 After reset at start of AI, do not uplink spin patch or set burst. Start sweeps every 30 s (SC1), 1 min (SC2), 90 s (SC3), 2 min (SC4). 07:45 Setup burst (SWECJ349). 07:55 Spinfit patch (SWECJ354). 08:05 Test completed: change sweep interval to 30 mins on all. (SWECJ340 and 339).
TM loss due to s/c anomaly
Probe 1 latched at -70 V
Time tagged burst operations with 2E+3B components at perigee. Loss of data for a little more than a minute expected.
SC3 system reboot. No data during this time.
Data loss due to ESA ground station problem
Probe 1 latched at +68 V. Probe 1 problem cured by EFW reset.
Probe 1 effectively lost from this time.
S/c problem caused data loss
S/c problem caused data loss
Attempts to bring P1 back to working order
WEC latchup. All EFW data lost until 2002-01-08 15:05:30. WEC restarted, EFW data regained
P2 bias went to 0xB2 (-300 nA), causing saturation at -68 V; later to 0 bias. Probable explanation is timing conflict between regular sweep command and extra bias command for probe 1.
Attitude manoeuvre
Attitude manoeuvre
Spin-up manoeuvre
Spin-up manoeuvre
WEC data lost following DWP watchdog reset on SC1.
P2 in bias voltage (Langmuir) mode for a week from this time
Bias current +16 nA during perigee passes.
Test different bias currents at perigee eclipse.
Bias current +16 nA during perigee passes.
Bias current +16 nA during perigee passes.
CTU switchover on SC2 caused loss of all science data.
Attitude manoeuvre
Attitude manoeuvre
WEC science telemetry bit error capable of causing all sorts of problems: timing jumps, apparent switches in EFW burst data, glitches.
WEC power cycled to clear up DWP memory latchup
Bias test, running -70 nA to all spheres
Corrupted WEC TM triggered s/c to reset WEC 020526 10:27. EFW then operated with default settings (e.g. non-ideal bias) until 020527 01:30.
Single bad EFW TM packet
Spacecraft manoeuvre contaminates data.
EFW telemetry completely confused.
Probe 1 effectively lost from this time.
WBD noise test
BM1 data intermittent (period about 20 s ???) due to wrong STAFF SA mode (TM overflow).
Latchup, SEU protection on ADC trigged, causing complete loss of data until power on/off cycle.

Strange bias sweep behaviour: sweeps take longer and longer time, the last one (at 15:19:20) takes 45 s. They are flagged as sweeps or playbacks only for the nominal time (1-2 s), and hence some HX data are contaminated
SC3 science and HK data lost due to s/c anomaly
SC2 reebooted by mistake at 22:5WEC not fully recovered until the end of a BM1 period at�2002-08-30 15:30.
Data loss for s/c reasons.
Data loss for s/c reasons.
Data loss for s/c reasons.
Data loss for s/c reasons.
Data loss for s/c reasons.
Data loss for s/c reasons.
S/c problem caused loss of sun reference pulse and thus scrambling of WEC data. The EFW onboard spinfits should be crazy, as there is no sun pulse.
EFW data scrambled, though analog signals to WHISPER and STAFF are all right. Presumably a radiation induced SEU.
Testing the FGM burst trig flag
Testing the FGM burst trig flag
Attitude manoeuvre
Attitude manoeuvre
Attitude manoeuvre
WEC turned off by SC after DWP voltage flag = 0xFF.
Ground station problems caused data loss.
Ground station problems caused data loss.
WEC turned off by s/c
Two-minute bias current sweeps using internal burst at 450 S/s
Two-minute bias current sweeps using internal burst at 450 S/s
By mistake, the failed P1 on SC13 were in E-field mode. This causes the flight s/w to use P12 for calcultating Vsc for HK and IEL, which thus are bad. Science data are OK.
By mistake, the failed P1 on SC13 were in E-field mode. This causes the flight s/w to use P12 for calcultating Vsc for HK and IEL, which thus are bad. Science data are OK.
WEC problems probably due to SEUs in DWP.
WEC problems probably due to SEUs in DWP.
ADCE switchover on SC2.
Uncontrolled manoeuvre
Spacecraft anomaly caused scrambled and lost science data.
Spacecraft anomaly caused scrambled and lost science data.
C2 is bad after a spontanous EFW reset.
S/c SSR anomaly causing data loss
S/c SSR anomaly causing data loss
WEC data lost during this period.
Data gap due to rain dance procedure.
Partial BM1 loss.
Attempting to get P1 back to life by deploying 16 both s/c cm more. Deployment worked, but P1 remains unfunctional on SC13.
Attempting to get P1 back to life by deploying 16 both s/c cm more. Deployment worked, but P1 remains unfunctional on SC13.
Bad HX packet
WEC reset, followed by EFW in h/w default mode (bias -40 nA)
Guard 0 V on probes 3 and 4
Partial BM1 loss.
EFW in NULL mode, i.e. no telemetry, due to spurious command.
Attitude manoeuvre
Attitude manoeuvre
Attitude manoeuvre
Attitude manoeuvre
WEC off due to DWP problem.
Uplink problem causing setup delay.
WEC switchoff, probably SEU in DWP
DWP problem?
Partial loss of BM3 dump.
Guard and puck variations.
Guard and puck variations.
WEC data loss.
BM1 data chopped up.
Data loss due to ground station problem.
3 x 450 samples/s: E-field V12M, Langmuir mode V3V4M
Data chopped up.
Bad HX telemetry packet.
Very bad data, probably because of high density and too large bias current.
Eclipse bias +16 nA was commanded 20 minutes too early.
SC anomaly during upload.
Single bad EFW TM packet.
EFW in NULL sampling mode, possibly due to spurious command.
Sync loss between EFW and DWP
EFW switched off by DWP watchdog.
Wrong bias current (+16 nA) due to erroneous eclipse commanding by JSOC.
Testing 16 bit sweeps and new WEC sequences. Test should have run on SC13, but note problems on SC1 on line above.
EFW in HXONLY mode (by spurious command?). In addition, the HX data for 23:59 - 02:06 are bad because of a bad burst dump.
P1 first stuck at +70 V, then bad guard voltage causing strange data from 00:07:01 until reset.
Testing flight software 2.4 and new WEC sequences (NM1/TM0 and BM1/TM1).
WEC macro problem caused loss of much BM1 data.
EFW in HXONLY mode (by spurious command?). In addition, HX data are bad 02:50-04:57 because of a bad burst dump.

Testing flight software 2.4 and new WEC sequences (NM1/TM0, BM1/TM1 and BM1/TM2). We have TM2 (22 kbit/s) for the last ten minutes of the BM1 interval. Functions used on each spacecraft in the different sampling mode: SC1: TM0: V23V34L (0x9E) TM1: V23V34M (0x9E) TM2: V2V3V4M (0x1E) SC3: TM0: V2V34L (0x94) TM1: V2V34M (0x9F) TM2: V2V3V34M (0x1F)
Very bad data due to high density.
Very bad data due to high density.
Attitude manoeuvre.
Attitude manoeuvre.
Attitude manoeuvre.
Attitude manoeuvre.
DWP buffer overflow.
P3 stuck at -10 V.
WEC switchoff.
Radial delta-v manoeuvre.
DWP buffer overflow during BM1.
Attitude manoeuvre.
Attitude manoeuvre.
Attitude manoeuvre.
Data gap due to ground station problem.
Last expected occurrence of small WEC TM overflow problem that has occurred now and then lately.
Radial delta-v manoeuvre.
Radial delta-v manoeuvre.
All probes saturated at -68 V
Bad data (presumably DWP error)
Axial delta-v manoeuvre.
Axial delta-v manoeuvre.
HXONLY
Something strange happens to p1, it jumps by about +2 V.

Sweep tests, bad bias -424 nA on p3,4. Intermediate sweeps on P34, internal burst. (Original request in ref 1 for slow sweeps at perigee was for a time outside data acquisition and had to be replaced, see ref 2)
Sweep tests, bad bias -424 nA on p3,4. Intermediate sweeps on P34, internal burst.
Bad data after spontaneous reset.
Bad probe 3 stuck at -68 V.
Slow sweep tests on P34.
Slow sweep tests.

Bad sweep handling. The EFW telemetry has bad packets from DWP such that the FDM is not properly decoded for all packets. In this case one FDM containing a sweep=on flag is missing so the sweep data are not removed as they should.
Perigee almost-floating bias test on P34: bias -8 nA, guard 0 V.
Bad HX packet.
WEC off
EFW bad data
WEC off
EFW data gaps
P1 stuck at +68 V until 09:42:23, then bad guard until reset at 20:30.
P3 goes positive after a sweep.
Attitude manoeuvre.
Attitude manoeuvre.
Slow sweeps on P34
WEC power cycling for WHISPER problem.
WEC data gap due to DWP problem?
WEC power cycling for DWP latchup, curing a STAFF cal problem
Single bad HX packet.
WEC emergency mode due to DWP problem, causing 0 bias.
WEC power cycle to clear up DWP problem.
NULL mode.
Single bad HX packet.
WEC problems due to proton event
WEC problems due to proton event
All Cluster data lost due to proton event impact on s/c systems
WEC and EFW problems during solar proton event
WEC power cycling following solar proton event problems
Bad data after spontaneous reset.

Probe 3 stuck at around -10 V (just like probe 1). It is interesting that the problem went away at the first Whisper sounding in BM (the Whisper soundings in NM did not help)! Both p3, p34 and p32 are affected.
Buffer overflow in DWP during BM.
Bad data after spontaneous EFW reset.
Bias test, P34 guard zero
Sweep interval 10 minutes
WBD problem turned WEC off. Several tests followed up to Dec 18.
Sweep interval 30 minutes. Should have run also on SC3, but the WBD problem stopped this.
Slow sweeps on P2. Should have run also on SC3, but the WBD problem stopped this.
Single bad HX packet.
Attitude manoeuvre

Attitude manoeuvre
Attitude manoeuvre
DWP/WBD command problem
DWP/WBD command problem
DWP/WBD command problem
EFW problem
NULL sampling mode
HXONLY sampling mode
Bad EFW data. It is not clear what happened to EFW, but all quantities are stuck at fixed values.
WEC off by onboard monitoring
EFW/DWP communication problem
Bad data after spontaneous EFW reset
Single bad HX packet
Probe 1 at large positive potential but not quite stuck
Probe 1 suddenly goes positive (saturated) and then comes back but still stays bad at positive values until it is restored by a bias sweep.
Whisper continuously active
Single bad HX packet
WEC power cycle to clear up DWP problem.

Radial delta-v manoeuvre

WEC switched off by s/c

Bad data. It looks like we have a lot of digital bit errors in the telemetry, which causes spikes in the measured data but also timing errors. It is probably an internal DWP problem, since it is cleared by the "stop macro" command at 10:07.
Spin-down manoeuvre
Spin-down manoeuvre
Spin-up manoeuvre
Spin-down manoeuvre
Probe 1 at large positive potential but not quite stuck, problem was cleared by EFW reset

WEC off
S/C problem: CTU switchover

WEC switched off by s/c. Note: Switch-off time in first ESOC mail is wrong.
WEC switched off by s/c

Payload off during long (apogee) eclipse
EFW data lost for almost 51 h, presumably DWP problem.
BM1 data chopped up, presumably DWP problem.
Single bad TM packet
Data lost due to s/c problem
FSW 2.1 run instead of 2.4
EFW data lost or bad, presumably DWP problem
NULL sampling mode
WEC switched off by s/c
DWP problem?
Badly chopped up data finally cured by WEC power cycle.
WEC switched off by s/c
EFW TM confused.
S/c problem (CTU switchover)
S/c problem (CTU switchover)
WEC off following spurious WBD command.
Bad EFW TM followed by WEC off by monitoring.
DWP time problem gave bad EFW TM, followed by WEC off by monitoring.
Burst dump lost due to dump made in BM1 rather than BM3.
WEC emergency mode following DWP reset; -40 nA on all probes.
DWP problem gave bad EFW TM, followed by WEC off by monitoring.
WEC switched off by onboard monitoring
P2 at 25 S/s rather than P23, for SC13 only
WEC overflow due to wrong correlator mode
No HK data due to s/c problem. No science data due to (planned) eclipse ops
WEC off following spurious WBD command
Data overwritten onboard
DWP latchup, eventually cleared up by WEC power cycle
Instrument hangup
Slow sweeps on P2 SC13 in plasmasphere/plasmapause
DWP latchup, partial TM loss and erroneous EFW power status
No EFW TM. DWP or EFW problem, not investigated.
Testing sweeps at different sweep rates
Testing coarse sweeps in plasmasphere
Testing fine sweeps in plasmasphere
Unidentified DWP problem caused EFW and WHISPER passive data loss
SC1 raindance procedure.
WEC off due to DWP latchup.
EFW bad data due to DWP problem (SEU).
One bad EFW packet, due to DWP problem (SEU).
EFW off due to DWP problem (SEU).
WEC off by DWP voltage monitoring.
WEC emergency mode following DWP reset, -40 nA on all probes.
WEC off by DWP voltage monitoring.
WEC off by DWP voltage monitoring.
Payload off following CTU switchover.
RTU switchover recovery plan.
SC1 battery problem in short eclipse.
WEC switched off by voltage monitoring.
WEC switched off because of an uncommanded WBD on following a DWP watchdog reset.
DWP problem finally cured by WEC power cycle. Problem may have started earlier than stated here, and also end somewhat earlier (or possibly later).
